III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• A review of R. 400.4163 Health status assessment; notification; debriefing;
reporting was reviewed with the Chief Administrator to ensure details of each
restraint is documented in incident reports per the expectations in the rule.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:

• Provided consultation to the facility that the rule does not require them to
sound the fire alarm for each fire drill as the alarms would be tested and
maintained annually.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the facility’s budget
and the agency’s financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
The program is not under any corrective action plans. The Chief Administrator
reported the program is operating well overall with a learning period they expected
with a new program. The facility is running two of the four programs and are
looking to increase and stabilize staffing before opening additional units. The Chief
Administrator reported the programming for the youth is functioning well and staff
are adapting to the expectations and working well with their current youth.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff and Youth were interviewed face-to-face at the facility on October 10, 2023.
The staff interviewed were two direct care staff and one supervisor. The staff all
reported they feel supported on the unit during their shifts and identified who they
would reach out to for answers to any questions that arise. The staff all reported
they felt well trained to do their jobs and did not have any concerns about the
program.
The youth interviewed all reported feeling safe at the Lotus program. They
reported feeling supported by the staff and identified their goals and the individuals
they work with to achieve their goals. The youth all reported having all their needs
met and did not report any concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on October 10, 2023.
The facility was clean and in good condition. The youth have individual bedrooms
and bathrooms that were appropriately furnished. The medications are double

locked and only the nursing staff have the ability to get into the medication carts.
The menu was posted, and the food is delivered directly from the main kitchen for
the youth. There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a regular license.
